kurals.child_explanation: Just like 'A' is the first letter you learn in school, God is the beginning of everything in this world! When you start learning, you begin with 'A'. Similarly, everything in the universe starts with God.

Learning is wonderful, but it's even more special when we remember to thank God! It's like learning to ride a bike - it's fun, but even better when you share your joy with someone who cares about you.
When we think about God and remember His goodness, we become happy and strong! It's like having a superhero friend who always helps you do your best.
People who remember God don't have to worry about bad things happening. It's like having an umbrella in the rain - you stay dry and safe!
When we praise God and think good thoughts, bad things can't stick to us. It's like having a special shield that keeps away all the yucky stuff!

Virtue.child_explanation: Just like 'A' is the first letter you learn in school, God is the beginning of everything in this world! When you start learning, you begin with 'A'. Similarly, everything in the universe starts with God.

Learning is wonderful, but it's even more special when we remember to thank God! It's like learning to ride a bike - it's fun, but even better when you share your joy with someone who cares about you.
When we think about God and remember His goodness, we become happy and strong! It's like having a superhero friend who always helps you do your best.
People who remember God don't have to worry about bad things happening. It's like having an umbrella in the rain - you stay dry and safe!
When we praise God and think good thoughts, bad things can't stick to us. It's like having a special shield that keeps away all the yucky stuff!

all_explanations.child_explanation: Just like 'A' is the first letter you learn in school, God is the beginning of everything in this world! When you start learning, you begin with 'A'. Similarly, everything in the universe starts with God.
all_explanations.original_english: As the letter A is the first of all letters  so the eternal God is first in the world

all_explanations.child_explanation: Learning is wonderful, but it's even more special when we remember to thank God! It's like learning to ride a bike - it's fun, but even better when you share your joy with someone who cares about you.
all_explanations.original_english: What Profit have those derived from learning  who worship not the good feet of Him who is possessed of pure knowledge ?

all_explanations.child_explanation: When we think about God and remember His goodness, we become happy and strong! It's like having a superhero friend who always helps you do your best.
all_explanations.original_english: They who are united to the glorious feet of Him who passes swiftly over the flower of the mind  shall flourish long above all worlds

all_explanations.child_explanation: People who remember God don't have to worry about bad things happening. It's like having an umbrella in the rain - you stay dry and safe!
all_explanations.original_english: To those who meditate the feet of Him who is void of desire or aversion  evil shall never come

all_explanations.child_explanation: When we praise God and think good thoughts, bad things can't stick to us. It's like having a special shield that keeps away all the yucky stuff!
all_explanations.original_english: The two fold deeds that spring from darkness shall not adhere to those who delight in the true praise of God

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Those shall long proposer who abide in the faultless way of Him who has destroyed the five desires of the senses

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Anxiety of mind cannot be removed  except from those who are united to the feet of Him who is incomparable

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: None can swim the sea of vice  but those who are united to the feet of that gracious Being who is a sea of virtue

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The head that worships not the feet of Him who is possessed of eight attributes  is as useless as a sense without the power of sensation

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about God and how important it is to remember Him. Just like we remember our parents who love us, we should remember God who created everything!
all_explanations.original_english: None can swim the great sea of births but those who are united to the feet of God

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: By the continuance of rain the world is preserved in existence; it is therefore worthy to be called ambrosia

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Rain produces good food  and is itself food

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: If the cloud  withholding rain  deceive (our hopes) hunger will long distress the sea girt spacious world

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about money and things we own. It's good to have what we need, but it's even better to share with others who don't have enough!
all_explanations.original_english: If the abundance of wealth imparting rain diminish  the labour of the plough must cease

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Rain by its absence ruins men; and by its existence restores them to fortune

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: If no drop falls from the clouds  not even the green blade of grass will be seen

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about money and things we own. It's good to have what we need, but it's even better to share with others who don't have enough!
all_explanations.original_english: Even the wealth of the wide sea will be diminished  if the cloud that has drawn (its waters) up gives them not back again (in rain)

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: If the heaven dry up  neither yearly festivals  nor daily worship will be offered in this world  to the celestials

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: If rain fall not  penance and alms deeds will not dwell within this spacious world

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: If it be said that the duties of life cannot be discharged by any person without water  so without rain there cannot be the flowing of water

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The end and aim of all treatise is to extol beyond all other excellence  the greatness of those who  while abiding in the rule of conduct peculiar to their state  have abandoned all desire

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: To describe the measure of the greatness of those who have forsaken the two fold desires  is like counting the dead

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The greatness of those who have discovered the properties of both states of being  and renounced the world  shines forth on earth (beyond all others)

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: He who guides his five senses by the hook of wisdom will be a seed in the world of heaven

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: Indra  the king of the inhabitants of the spacious heaven  is himself  a sufficient proof of the strength of him who has subdued his five senses

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The great will do those things which is difficult to be done; but the mean cannot do them

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: The world is within the knowledge of him who knows the properties of taste  sight  touch  hearing and smell

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The hidden words of the men whose words are full of effect  will shew their greatness to the world

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: The anger of those who have ascended the mountain of goodness  though it continue but for a moment  cannot be resisted

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The virtuous are truly called Anthanar; because in their conduct towards all creatures they are clothed in kindness

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Virtue will confer heaven and wealth; what greater source of happiness can man possess ?

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: There can be no greater source of good than (the practice of) virtue; there can be no greater source of evil than the forgetfulness of it

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: As much as possible  in every way  incessantly practise virtue

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Let him who does virtuous deeds be of spotless mind; to that extent is virtue; all else is vain show

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: That conduct is virtue which is free from these four things  viz  malice  desire  anger and bitter speech

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Defer not virtue to another day; receive her now; and at the dying hour she will be your undying friend

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: The fruit of virtue need not be described in books; it may be inferred from seeing the bearer of a palanquin and the rider therein

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: If one allows no day to pass without some good being done  his conduct will be a stone to block up the passage to other births

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!

all_explanations.original_english: Innumerable are the thoughts which occupy the mind of (the unwise)  who know not that they shall live another moment

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about love! Love makes us feel warm and happy, like a big hug from someone special. We should show love to our family and friends!
all_explanations.original_english: The love of the soul to the body is like (the love of) a bird to its egg which it flies away from and leaves empty

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: Death is like sleep; birth is like awaking from it

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about family and home. Our family loves us and takes care of us, just like a bird's nest keeps baby birds safe and warm!
all_explanations.original_english: It seems as if the soul  which takes a temporary shelter in a body  had not attained a home

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Whatever thing  a man has renounced  by that thing; he cannot suffer pain

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: After a man has renounced (all things)  there will still be many things in this world (which he may enjoy); if he should desire them  let him  while it is time abandon (the world)

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Let the five senses be destroyed; and at the same time  let everything be abandoned that (the ascetic) has (formerly) desired

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: To be altogether destitute is the proper condition of those who perform austerities; if they possess anything  it will change (their resolution) and bring them back to their confused state

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: What means the addition of other things those who are attempting to cut off (future) births  when even their body is too much (for them)

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Shall enter realms above the powers divine

all_explanations.original_english: Sorrows will never let go their hold of those who give not up their hold of desire

all_explanations.original_english: Those who have entirely renounced (all things and all desire) have obtained (absorption into God); all others wander in confusion  entangled in the net of (many) births

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Inglorious births are produced by the confusion (of mind) which considers those things to be real which are not real

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: A clear  undimmed vision of things will deliver its possessors from the darkness of future births  and confer the felicity (of heaven)

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Heaven is nearer than earth to those men of purified minds who are freed from from doubt

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: Even those who have all the knowledge which can be attained by the five senses  will derive no benefit from it  if they are without a knowledge of the true nature of things

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: (True) knowledge is the perception concerning every thing of whatever kind  that that thing is the true thing

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: They  who in this birth have learned to know the True Being  enter the road which returns not into this world

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Let it not be thought that there is another birth for him whose mind having thoroughly considered (all it has been taught) has known the True Being

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: True knowledge consists in the removal of ignorance; which is (the cause of) births  and the perception of the True Being who is (the bestower of) heaven

all_explanations.original_english: He who so lives as to know Him who is the support of all things and abandon all desire  will be freed from the evils which would otherwise cleave to him and destroy (his efforts after absorption)

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us not to get too angry. When we're angry, we should take deep breaths and calm down, just like counting to ten before we speak!
all_explanations.original_english: If the very names of these three things  desire  anger  and confusion of mind  be destroyed  then will also perish evils (which flow from them)

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: (The wise) say that the seed  which produces unceasing births  at all times  to all creatures  is desire

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: If anything be desired  freedom from births should be desired; that (freedom from births) will be attained by desiring to be without desire

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: There is in this world no excellence equal to freedom from desire; and even in that world  there is nothing like it

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about love! Love makes us feel warm and happy, like a big hug from someone special. We should show love to our family and friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Purity (of mind) consists in freedom from desire; and that (freedom from desire) is the fruit of the love of truth

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: They are said to be free (from future birth) who are freed from desire; all others (who  whatever else they may be free from  are not freed from desire) are not thus free

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: It is the chief duty of (an ascetic) to watch against desire with (jealous) fear; for it has power to deceive (and destroy) him

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: If a man thoroughly cut off all desire  the deeds  which confer immortality  will come to him  in the path in which he seeks them

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: There is no sorrow to those who are without desire; but where that is  (sorrow) will incessantly come  more and more

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Even while in this body  joy will never depart (from the mind  in which) desire  that sorrow of sorrows  has been destroyed

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The removal of desire  whose nature it is never to be satisfied  will immediately confer a nature that can never be changed

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Perseverance comes from a prosperous fate  and idleness from an adverse fate

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: An adverse fate produces folly  and a prosperous fate produces enlarged knowledge

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: Although (a man) may study the most polished treatises  the knowledge which fate has decreed to him will still prevail

all_explanations.original_english: In the acquisition of property  every thing favourable becomes unfavourable  and (on the other hand) everything unfavourable becomes favourable  (through the power of fate)

all_explanations.original_english: Whatever is not conferred by fate cannot be preserved although it be guarded with most painful care; and that  which fate has made his  cannot be lost  although one should even take it and throw it away

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The destitute will renounce desire (and become ascetics)  if (fate) do not make them suffer the hindrances to which they are liable  and they pass away

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The destitute will renounce desire (and become ascetics)  if (fate) do not make them suffer the hindrances to which they are liable  and they pass away

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: How is it that those  who are pleased with good fortune  trouble themselves when evil comes  (since both are equally the decree of fate) ?

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!

all_explanations.original_english: He who possesses these six things  an army  a people  wealth  ministers  friends and a fortress  is a lion among kings

all_explanations.original_english: Never to fail in these four things  fearlessness  liberality  wisdom  and energy  is the kingly character

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: These three things  viz  vigilance  learning  and bravery  should never be wanting in the ruler of a country

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: He is a king who  with manly modesty  swerves not from virtue  and refrains from vice

all_explanations.original_english: The whole world will exalt the country of the king who is easy of access  and who is free from harsh language

all_explanations.original_english: Water will flow from a well in the sand in proportion to the depth to which it is dug  and knowledge will flow from a man in proportion to his learning

all_explanations.original_english: The unlearned  though born in a high caste  are not equal in dignity to the learned; though they may have been born in a low caste.

all_explanations.original_english: Wealth (gained) by the ear is wealth of wealth; that wealth is the chief of all wealth

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: When there is no food for the ear  give a little also to the stomach

all_explanations.original_english: Those who in this world enjoy instruction which is the food of the ear  are equal to the Gods  who enjoy the food of the sacrifices

all_explanations.original_english: Although a man be without learning  let him listen (to the teaching of the learned); that will be to him a staff in adversity

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: The words of the good are like a staff in a slippery place

all_explanations.original_english: Let a man listen  never so little  to good (instruction)  even that will bring him great dignity

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The ear which has not been bored by instruction  although it hears  is deaf

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: It is a rare thing to find modesty  a reverend mouth with those who have not received choice instruction

all_explanations.original_english: What does it matter whether those men live or die  who can judge of tastes by the mouth  and not by the ear ?

all_explanations.original_english: Not to permit the mind to go where it lists  to keep it from evil  and to employ it in good  this is wisdom.

all_explanations.original_english: To discern the truth in every thing  by whomsoever spoken  is wisdom.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: o speak so as that the meaning may easily enter the mind of the hearer  and to discern the subtlest thought which may lie hidden in the words of others  this is wisdom.

all_explanations.original_english: To secure the friendship of the great is true wisdom; it is (also) wisdom to keep (that friendship unchanged  and) not opening and closing (like the lotus flower).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: his is to wisely live and well. To live as the world lives  is wisdom.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The wise are those who know beforehand what will happen; those who do not know this are the unwise.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Not to fear what ought to be feared  is folly; it is the work of the wise to fear what should be feared.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us not to hurt others. We should be gentle and kind, just like we want others to be gentle and kind to us!
all_explanations.original_english: No terrifying calamity will happen to the wise  who (foresee) and guard against coming evils.

all_explanations.original_english: Those who possess wisdom  possess every thing; those who have not wisdom  whatever they may possess  have nothing.

all_explanations.original_english: Truly great is the excellence of those (kings) who are free from pride  anger  and lust.

all_explanations.original_english: Avarice  undignified pride  and low pleasures are faults in a king.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Those who fear guilt  if they commit a fault small as a millet seed  will consider it to be as large as a palm yra tree.

all_explanations.original_english: Guard against faults as a matter (of great consequence; for) faults are a deadly enemy.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The prosperity of him who does not timely guard against faults  will perish like straw before fire.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: What fault will remain in the king who has put away his own evils  and looks after the evils of others.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about money and things we own. It's good to have what we need, but it's even better to share with others who don't have enough!
all_explanations.original_english: The wealth of the avaricious man  who does not expend it for the purposes for which he ought to expend it will waste away and not continue.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Griping avarice is not to be reckoned as one among other faults; (it stands alone greater than all).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Let no (one) praise himself  at any time; let him not desire to do useless things.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: If (a king) enjoys  privately the things which he desires  the designs of his enemies will be useless.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: Let (a king) ponder well its value  and secure the friendship of men of virtue and of mature knowledge.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: Let (a king) procure and kindly care for men who can overcome dificulties when they occur  and guard against them before they happen.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: To cherish great men and make them his own  is the most difficult of all difficult things.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: So to act as to make those men  his own  who are greater than himself is of all powers the highest.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: As a king must use his ministers as eyes (in managing his kingdom)  let him well examine their character and qualifications before he engages them.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: There will be nothing left for enemies to do  against him who has the power of acting (so as to secure) the fellowship of worthy men.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Who are great enough to destroy him who has servants that have power to rebuke him ?

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: The king  who is without the guard of men who can rebuke him  will perish  even though there be no one to destroy him.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: There can be no gain to those who have no capital; and in like manner there can be no permanence to those who are without the support of adherents.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: It is tenfold more injurious to abandon the friendship of the good  than to incur the hatred of the many.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: (True) greatness fears the society of the base; it is only the low - minded who will regard them as friends.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: As water changes (its nature)  from the nature of the soil (in which it flows)  so will the character of men resemble that of their associates.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The power of knowing is from the mind; (but) his character is from that of his associates.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: Wisdom appears to rest in the mind  but it really exists to a man in his companions.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Chaste company is the staf on which come  these two things  viz  purity of mind and purity of conduct.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: To the pure minded there will be a good posterity. By those whose associates are pure  no deeds will be done that are not good.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Goodness of mind will give wealth  and good society will bring with it all praise  to men.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Although they may have great (natural) goodness of mind  yet good society will tend to strengthen it.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Future bliss is (the result) of goodness of mind; and even this acquires strength from the society of the good.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: There is no greater help than the company of the good; there is no greater source of sorrow than the company of the wicked.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Let a man reflect on what will be lost  what will be acquired and (from these) what will be his ultimate gain  and (then  let him) act.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: There is nothing too dificult to (be attained by) those who  before they act  reflect well themselves  and thoroughly consider (the matter) with chosen friends.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Wise men will not  in the hopes of profit  undertake works that will consume their principal.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Those who fear reproach will not commence anything which has not been (thoroughly considered) and made clear to them.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: One way to promote the prosperity of an enemy  is (for a king) to set out (to war) without having thoroughly weighed his ability (to cope with its chances).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: He will perish who does not what is not fit to do; and he also will perish who does not do what it is fit to do.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Consider  and then undertake a matter; after having undertaken it  to say We will consider  is folly.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The work  which is not done by suitable methods  will fail though many stand to uphold it.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: There are failures even in acting well  when it is done without knowing the various dispositions of men

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Let a man reflect  and do things which bring no reproach; the world will not approve  with him  of things which do not become of his position to adopt.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us to always tell the truth! Being honest is like being a superhero - it takes courage, but it's always the right thing to do!
all_explanations.original_english: Let (one) weigh well the strength of the deed (he purposes to do)  his own strength  the strength of his enemy  and the strength of the allies (of both)  and then let him act.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: There is nothing which may not be accomplished by those who  before they attack (an enemy)  make themselves acquainted with their own ability  and with whatever else is (needful) to be known  and apply themselves wholly to their object.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: There are many who  ignorant of their (want of) power (to meet it)  have haughtily set out to war  and broken down in the midst of it.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: He will quickly perish who  ignorant of his own resources flatters himself of his greatness  and does not live in peace with his neighbours.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The axle tree of a bandy  loaded only with peacocks feathers will break  if it be greatly overloaded.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: There will be an end to the life of him who  having climbed out to the end of a branch  ventures to go further.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Let a man know the measure of his ability (to give)  and let him give accordingly; such giving is the way to preserve his property.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: Even though the income (of a king) be small  it will not cause his (ruin)  if his outgoings be not larger than his income.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The prosperity of him who lives without knowing the measure (of his property)  will perish  even while it seems to continue.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about money and things we own. It's good to have what we need, but it's even better to share with others who don't have enough!
all_explanations.original_english: The measure of his wealth will quickly perish  whose liberality weighs not the measure of his property.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: A crow will overcome an owl in the day time; so the king who would conquer his enemy must have (a suitable) time.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: Acting at the right season  is a cord that will immoveably bind success (to a king).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Is there anything dificult for him to do  who acts  with (the right) instruments at the right time ?

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Though (a man) should meditate (the conquest of) the world  he may accomplish it if he acts in the right time  and at the right place.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: They who thoughtfully consider and wait for the (right) time (for action)  may successfully meditate (the conquest of) the world

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The self-restraint of the energetic (while waiting for a suitable opportunity)  is like the drawing back of a fighting-ram in order to butt.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us not to get too angry. When we're angry, we should take deep breaths and calm down, just like counting to ten before we speak!
all_explanations.original_english: The wise will not immediately and hastily shew out their anger; they will watch their time  and restrain it within.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: If one meets his enemy  let him show him all respect  until the time for his destruction is come; when that is come  his head will be easily brought low.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: If a rare opportunity occurs  while it lasts  let a man do that which is rarely to be accomplished (but for such an opportunity).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: At the time when one should use self-control  let him restrain himself like a heron; and  let him like it  strike  when there is a favourable opportunity.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: Let not (a king) despise (an enemy)  nor undertake any thing (against him)  until he has obtained (a suitable) place for besieging him.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Even to those who are men of power and expedients  an attack in connection with a fortification will yield many advantages.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Even the powerless will become powerful and conquer  if they select a proper field (of action)  and guard themselves  while they make war on their enemies.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: If they who draw near (to fight) choose a suitable place to approach (their enemy)  the latter  will have to relinquish the thought which they once entertained  of conquering them.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: In deep water  a crocodile will conquer (all other animals); but if it leave the water  other animals will conquer it.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Wide chariots  with mighty wheels  will not run on the ocean; neither will ships that the traverse ocean  move on the earth.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: You will need no other aid than fearlessness  if you thoroughly reflect (on what you are to do)  and select (a suitable) place for your operations.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The power of one who has a large army will perish  if he goes into ground where only a small army can act.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: It is a hazardous thing to attack men in their own country  although they may neither have power nor a good fortress.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: A fox can kill a fearless  warrior-faced elephant  if it go into mud in which its legs sink down.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Let (a minister) be chosen  after he has been tried by means of these four things  viz -his virtue  (love of) money  (love of) sexual pleasure  and tear of (losing) life.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: (The kings) choice should (fall) on him  who is of good family  who is free from faults  and who has the modesty which fears the wounds (of sin).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: When even men  who have studied the most dificult works  and who are free from faults  are (carefully) examined  it is a rare thing to find them without ignorance.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Let (a king) consider (a mans) good qualities  as well as his faults  and then judge (of his character) by that which prevails.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: A mans deeds are the touchstone of his greatness and littleness.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: Let (a king) avoid choosing men who have no relations; such men have no attachment  and thereforehave no fear of crime.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: To choose ignorant men  through partiality  is the height of folly.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us not to get too angry. When we're angry, we should take deep breaths and calm down, just like counting to ten before we speak!
all_explanations.original_english: Sorrow that will not leave even his posterity will come upon him chooses a stranger whose character he has not known

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: Let (a king) choose no one without previous consideration; after he has made his choice  let him unhesitatingly select for each such duties as are appropriate.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: To make choice of one who has not been examined  and to entertain doubts respecting one who has been chosen  will produce irremediable sorrow.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: He should be employed (by a king)  whose nature leads him to choose the good  after having weighed both the evil and the good in any undertaking.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: Let him do (the kings) work who can enlarge the sources (of revenue)  increase wealth and considerately prevent the accidents (which would destroy it).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: Let the choice (of a king) fall upon him who largely possesses these four things  love  knowledge  a clear mind and freedom from covetousness.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: Even when (a king) has tried them in every possible way  there are many men who change  from the nature of the works (in which they may be employed).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: (A kings) work can only be accomplished by a man of wisdom and patient endurance; it is not of a nature to be given to one from mere personal attachment.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: Let (a king) act  after having considered the agent (whom he is to employ)  the deed (he desires to do)  and the time which is suitable to it.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: After having considered  this man can accomplish this  by these means   let (the king) leave with him the discharge of that duty.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: Having considered what work a man is fit for  let (the king) employ him in that work.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: Prosperity will leave (the king) who doubts the friendship of the man who steadily labours in the discharge of his duties.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: Let a king daily examine the conduct of his servants; if they do not act crookedly  the world will not act crookedly.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Even when (a mans) property is all gone  relatives will act towards him with their accustomed (kindness).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about money and things we own. It's good to have what we need, but it's even better to share with others who don't have enough!
all_explanations.original_english: If (a mans) relatives remain attached to him with unchanging love  it will be a source of ever- increasing wealth.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about money and things we own. It's good to have what we need, but it's even better to share with others who don't have enough!
all_explanations.original_english: The wealth of one who does not mingle freely with his relatives  will be like the filling of water in a spacious tank that has no banks.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about money and things we own. It's good to have what we need, but it's even better to share with others who don't have enough!
all_explanations.original_english: To live surrounded by relatives  is the advantage to be derived from the acquisition of wealth.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: He will be surrounded by numerous relatives who manifests generosity and affability.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us not to get too angry. When we're angry, we should take deep breaths and calm down, just like counting to ten before we speak!
all_explanations.original_english: No one  in all the world  will have so many relatives (about him)  as he who makes large gift  and does not give way to anger.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about money and things we own. It's good to have what we need, but it's even better to share with others who don't have enough!
all_explanations.original_english: The crows do not conceal (their prey)  but will call out for others (to share with them) while they eat it; wealth will be with those who show a similar disposition (towards their relatives).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: Many relatives will live near a king  when they observe that he does not look on all alike  but that he looks on each man according to his merit.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: Those who have been friends and have afterwards forsaken him  will return and join themselves (to him)  when the cause of disagreement is not to be found in him.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: When one may have left him  and for some cause has returned to him  let the king fulfil the object (for which he has come back) and thoughtfully receive him again.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us not to get too angry. When we're angry, we should take deep breaths and calm down, just like counting to ten before we speak!
all_explanations.original_english: More evil than excessive anger  is forgetfulness which springs from the intoxication of great joy.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: Forgetfulness will destroy fame  even as constant poverty destroys knowledge.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Thoughtlessness will never acquire fame; and this tenet is upheld by all treatises in the world.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Just as the coward has no defence (by whatever fortifications ha may be surrounded)  so the thoughtless has no good (whatever advantages he may possess).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The thoughtless man  who provides not against the calamities that may happen  will afterwards repent for his fault.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: There is nothing comparable with the possession of unfailing thoughtfulness at all times; and towards all persons.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: There is nothing too dificult to be accomplished  if a man set about it carefully  with unflinching endeavour.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Let (a man) observe and do these things which have been praised (by the wise); if he neglects and fails to perform them  for him there will be no (happiness) throughout the seven births.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: Let (a king) think of those who have been ruined by neglect  when his mind is elated with joy.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: It is easy for (one) to obtain whatever he may think of  if he can again think of it.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: To examine into (the crimes which may be committed)  to show no favour (to any one)  to desire to act with impartiality towards all  and to inflict (such punishments) as may be wisely resolved on  constitute rectitude.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: When there is rain  the living creation thrives; and so when the king rules justly  his subjects thrive.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: The sceptre of the king is the firm support of the Vedas of the Brahmin  and of all virtues therein described.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: The world will constantly embrace the feet of the great king who rules over his subjects with love.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: Rain and plentiful crops will ever dwell together in the country of the king who sways his sceptre with justice.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: It is not the javelin that gives victory  but the kings sceptre  if it do no injustice.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: The king defends the whole world; and justice  when administered without defect  defends the king.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: The king who gives not facile audience (to those who approach him)  and who does not examine and pass judgment (on their complaints)  will perish in disgrace.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: In guarding his subjects (against injury from others)  and in preserving them himself; to punish crime is not a fault in a king  but a duty.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: For a king to punish criminals with death  is like pulling up the weeds in the green corn.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: The king who gives himself up to oppression and acts unjustly (towards his subjects) is more cruel than the man who leads the life of a murderer.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about money and things we own. It's good to have what we need, but it's even better to share with others who don't have enough!
all_explanations.original_english: The request (for money) of him who holds the sceptre is like the word of a highway robber who stands with a weapon in hand and says give up your wealth.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: The country of the king who does not daily examine into the wrongs done and distribute justice  will daily fall to ruin.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: The king  who  without reflecting (on its evil consequences)  perverts justice  will lose at once both his wealth and his subjects.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: Will not the tears  shed by a people who cannot endure the oppression which they sufer (from their king)  become a saw to waste away his wealth ?

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Righteous government gives permanence to (the fame of) kings; without that their fame will have no endurance.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: As is the world without rain  so live a people whose king is without kindness.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: Property gives more sorrow than poverty  to those who live under the sceptre of a king without justice

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: If the king acts contrary to justice  rain will become unseasonable  and the heavens will withhold their showers.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: If the guardian (of the country) neglects to guard it  the produce of the cows will fail  and the men of six duties viz.  the Brahmins will forget the vedas.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: He is a king who having equitably examined (any injustice which has been brought to his notice)  suitably punishes it  so that it may not be again committed.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: Let the king  who desires that his prosperity may long remain  commence his preliminary enquires with strictness  and then punish with mildness.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: The cruel-sceptred king  who acts so as to put his subjects in fear  will certainly and quickly come to ruin.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: The king who is spoken of as cruel will quickly perish; his life becoming shortened.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about money and things we own. It's good to have what we need, but it's even better to share with others who don't have enough!
all_explanations.original_english: The great wealth of him who is dificult of access and possesses a sternness of countenance  is like that which has been obtained by a devil.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: The abundant wealth of the king whose words are harsh and whose looks are void of kindness  will instantly perish instead of abiding long  with him.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: Severe words and excessive punishments will be a file to waste away a kings power for destroying (his enemies).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: The prosperity of that king will waste away  who without reflecting (on his afairs himself)  commits them to his ministers  and (when a failure occurs) gives way to anger  and rages against them.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: The king who has not provided himself with a place of defence  will in times of war be seized with fear and quickly perish.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us not to hurt others. We should be gentle and kind, just like we want others to be gentle and kind to us!
