all_explanations.original_english: The earth bears up no greater burden than ignorant men whom a cruel sceptre attaches to itself (as the ministers of its evil deeds).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The world exists through that greatest ornament (of princes)  a gracious demeanour.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The prosperity of the world springs from the kindliness  the existence of those who have no (kindliness) is a burden to the earth.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us not to hurt others. We should be gentle and kind, just like we want others to be gentle and kind to us!
all_explanations.original_english: Of what avail is a song if it be inconsistent with harmony ? what is the use of eyes which possess no kindliness.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Beyond appearing to be in the face  what good do they do  those eyes in which is no well-regulated kindness ?

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Kind looks are the ornaments of the eyes; without these they will be considered (by the wise) to be merely two sores.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: They resemble the trees of the earth  who although they have eyes  never look kindly (on others).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Men without kind looks are men without eyes; those who (really) have eyes are also not devoid of kind looks.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: The world is theirs (kings) who are able to show kindness  without injury to their afairs  (administration of justice).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Patiently to bear with  and show kindness to those who grieve us  is the most excellent of all dispositions.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: Those who desire (to cultivate that degree of) urbanity which all shall love  even after swallowing the poison served to them by their friends  will be friendly with them.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: Let a king consider as his eyes these two things  a spy and a book (of laws) universally esteemed.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: It is the duty of a king to know quickly (by a spy) what all happens  daily  amongst all men.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: There is no way for a king to obtain conquests  who knows not the advantage of discoveries made by a spy.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: He is a spy who watches all men  to wit  those who are in the kings employment  his relatives  and his enemies.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: A spy is one who is able to assume an appearance which may create no suspicion (in the minds of others)  who fears no mans face  and who never reveals (his purpose).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: He is a spy who  assuming the appearance of an ascetic  goes into (whatever place he wishes)  examines into (all  that is needful)  and never discovers himself  whatever may be done to him.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: A spy is one who is able to discover what is hidden and who retains no doubt concerning what he has known.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: Let not a king receive the information which a spy has discovered and made known to him  until he has examined it by another spy.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: Let a king employ spies so that one may have no knowledge of the other; and when the information of three agrees together  let him receive it.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: Let not a king publicly confer on a spy any marks of his favour; if he does  he will divulge his own secret.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Energy makes out the man of property; as for those who are destitute of it  do they (really) possess what they possess ?

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about money and things we own. It's good to have what we need, but it's even better to share with others who don't have enough!
all_explanations.original_english: The possession of (energy of) mind is true property; the possession of wealth passes away and abides not.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: They who are possessed of enduring energy will not trouble themselves  saying  we have lost our property.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about money and things we own. It's good to have what we need, but it's even better to share with others who don't have enough!
all_explanations.original_english: Wealth will find its own way to the man of unfailing energy.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The stalks of water-flowers are proportionate to the depth of water; so is mens greatness proportionate to their minds.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: In all that a king thinks of  let him think of his greatness; and if it should be thrust from him (by fate)  it will have the nature of not being thrust from him.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The strong minded will not faint  even when all is lost; the elephant stands firm  even when wounded by a shower of arrows.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Those who have no (greatness of) mind  will not acquire the joy of saying in the world  we have excercised liaberality .

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Although the elephant has a large body  and a sharp tusk  yet it fears the attack of the tiger.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about money and things we own. It's good to have what we need, but it's even better to share with others who don't have enough!
all_explanations.original_english: Energy is mental wealth; those men who are destitute of it are only trees in the form of men

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: If (a king) enjoys  privately the things which he desires  the designs of his enemies will be useless.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about family and home. Our family loves us and takes care of us, just like a bird's nest keeps baby birds safe and warm!
all_explanations.original_english: Let those  who desire that their family may be illustrious  put away all idleness from their conduct.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about family and home. Our family loves us and takes care of us, just like a bird's nest keeps baby birds safe and warm!
all_explanations.original_english: The (lustre of the) family of the ignorant man  who acts under the influence of destructive laziness will perish  even before he is dead.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about family and home. Our family loves us and takes care of us, just like a bird's nest keeps baby birds safe and warm!
all_explanations.original_english: Family (greatness) will be destroyed  and faults will increase  in those men who give way to laziness  and put forth no dignified exertions.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Procrastination  forgetfulness  idleness  and sleep  these four things  form the vessel which is desired by those destined to destruction

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: It is a rare thing for the idle  even when possessed of the riches of kings who ruled over the whole earth  to derive any great benefit from it.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Those who through idleness  and do not engage themselves in dignified exertion  will subject.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: If idleness take up its abode in a king of high birth  it will make him a slave of his enemies.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about family and home. Our family loves us and takes care of us, just like a bird's nest keeps baby birds safe and warm!
all_explanations.original_english: When a man puts away idleness  the reproach which has come upon himself and his family will disappear.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: The king who never gives way to idleness will obtain entire possession of (the whole earth) passed over by him who measured (the worlds) with His foot.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Yield not to the feebleness which says  this is too difficult to be done; labour will give the greatness (of mind) which is necessary (to do it).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Take care not to give up exertion in the midst of a work; the world will abandon those who abandon their unfinished work.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The lustre of munificence will dwell only with the dignity of laboriousness or efforts.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The liberality of him  who does not labour  will fail  like the manliness of a hermaphrodite  who has a sword in its hand.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: He who desires not pleasure  but desires labour  will be a pillar to sustain his relations  wiping away their sorrows.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about money and things we own. It's good to have what we need, but it's even better to share with others who don't have enough!
all_explanations.original_english: Labour will produce wealth; idleness will bring poverty.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about God and how important it is to remember Him. Just like we remember our parents who love us, we should remember God who created everything!
all_explanations.original_english: They say that the black Mudevi (the goddess of adversity) dwells with laziness  and the Latchmi (the goddess of prosperity) dwells with the labour of the industrious.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Adverse fate is no disgrace to any one; to be without exertion and without knowing what should be known  is disgrace.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Although it be said that  through fate  it cannot be attained  yet labour  with bodily exertion  will yield its reward.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: They who labour on  without fear and without fainting will see even fate (put) behind their back.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: If troubles come  laugh; there is nothing like that  to press upon and drive away sorrow.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: A flood of troubles will be overcome by the (courageous) thought which the minds of the wise will entertain  even in sorrow.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: They give sorrow to sorrow  who in sorrow do not suffer sorrow.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Troubles will vanish (i.e.  will be troubled) before the man who (struggles against dificulties) as a buffalo (drawing a cart) through deep mire.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The troubles of that man will be troubled (and disappear) who  however thickly they may come upon him  does not abandon (his purpose).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about money and things we own. It's good to have what we need, but it's even better to share with others who don't have enough!
all_explanations.original_english: Will those men ever cry out in sorrow  we are destitute who  (in their prosperity)  give not way to (undue desire) to keep their wealth.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The great will not regard trouble as trouble  knowing that the body is the butt of trouble.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: That man never experiences sorrow  who does not seek for pleasure  and who considers distress to be natural (to man).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: He does not suffer sorrow  in sorrow who does not look for pleasure in pleasure.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The elevation  which even his enemies will esteem  will be gained by him  who regards pain as pleasure.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: The minister is one who can make an excellent choice of means  time  manner of execution  and the difficult undertaking (itself).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: The minister is one who in addition to the aforesaid five things excels in the possession of firmness  protection of subjects  clearness by learning  and perseverance.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: The minister is one who can efect discord (among foes)  maintain the goodwill of his friends and restore to friendship those who have seceded (from him).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: The minister is one who is able to comprehend (the whole nature of an undertaking)  execute it in the best manner possible  and ofer assuring advice (in time of necessity).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: He is the best helper (of the king) who understanding the duties  of the latter  is by his special learning  able to tender the fullest advice  and at all times conversant with the best method (of performing actions).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: What (contrivances) are there so acute as to resist those who possess natural acuteness in addition to learning ?.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Though you are acquainted with the (theoretical) methods (of performing an act)  understand the ways of the world and act accordingly.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: Although the king be utterly ignorant  it is the duty of the minister to give (him) sound advice.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: Far better are seventy crores of enemies (for a king) than a minister at his side who intends (his) ruin.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Those ministers who are destitute of (executive) ability will fail to carry out their projects  although they may have contrived aright.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: The possession of that goodness which is called the goodness of speech is (even to others) better than any other goodness.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about money and things we own. It's good to have what we need, but it's even better to share with others who don't have enough!
all_explanations.original_english: Since (both) wealth and evil result from (their)speech  ministers should most carefully guard themselves against faultiness therein.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: The (ministers) speech is that which seeks (to express) elements as bind his friends (to himself) and is so delivered as to make even his enemies desire (his friendship).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Understand the qualities (of your hearers) and (then) make your speech; for superior to it  there is neither virtue nor wealth.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Deliver your speech  after assuring yourself that no counter speech can defeat your own.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: It is the opinion of those who are free from defects in diplomacy that the minister should speak so as to make his hearers desire (to hear more) and grasp the meaning of what he hears himself.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: It is impossible for any one to conquer him by intrique who possesses power of speech  and is neither faulty nor timid.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: If there be those who can speak on various subjects in their proper order and in a pleasing manner  the world would readily accept them.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: They will desire to utter many words  who do not know how to speak a few faultless ones.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Those who are unable to set forth their acquirements (before others) are like flowers blossoming in a cluster and yet without fragrance.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about money and things we own. It's good to have what we need, but it's even better to share with others who don't have enough!
all_explanations.original_english: The efficacy of support will yield (only) wealth; (but) the efficacy of action will yield all that is desired.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Ministers should at all times avoid acts which  in addition to fame  yield no benefit (for the future).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Those who say  we will become (better) should avoid the performance of acts that would destroy (their fame).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Those who have infallible judgement though threatened with peril will not do acts which have brought disgrace (on former ministers).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Let a minister never do acts of which he would have to grieve saying  what is this I have done; (but) should he do (them)  it were good that he grieved not.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Though a minister may see his mother starve; let him do not act which the wise would (treat with contempt).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about money and things we own. It's good to have what we need, but it's even better to share with others who don't have enough!
all_explanations.original_english: Far more excellent is the extreme poverty of the wise than wealth obtained by heaping up of sinful deeds.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The actions of those  who have not desisted from doing deeds forbidden (by the great)  will  even if they succeed  cause them sorrow.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: All that has been obtained with tears (to the victim) will depart with tears (to himself); but what has been by fair means; though with loss at first  will afterwards yield fruit.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: (For a minister) to protect (his king) with wealth obtained by foul means is like preserving a vessel of wet clay by filling it with water.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Firmness in action is (simply) ones firmness of mind; all other (abilities) are not of this nature.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Not to perform a ruinous act  and not to be discouraged by the ruinous termination of an act  are the two maxims which  the wise say  from the principles of those who have investigated the subject.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: So to perform an act as to publish it (only) at its termination is (true) manliness; for to announce it beforehand  will cause irremediable sorrow.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: To say (how an act is to be performed) is (indeed) easy for any one; but far dificult it is to do according to what has been said.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: The firmness in action of those who have become great by the excellence (of their counsel) will  by attaining its fulfilment in the person of the king  be esteemed (by all).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: If those who have planned (an undertaking) possess firmness (in executing it) they will obtain what they have desired even as they have desired it.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Let none be despised for (their) size; (for) the world has those who resemble the linchpin of the big rolling car.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: An act that has been firmly resolved on must be as firmly carried out without delay.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Though it should cause increasing sorrow (at the outset)  do with firmness the act that yield bliss (in the end).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The great will not esteem those who esteem not firmness of action  whatever other abilities the latter may possess.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us not to hurt others. We should be gentle and kind, just like we want others to be gentle and kind to us!
all_explanations.original_english: Consultation ends in forming a resolution (to act); (but) delay in the execution of that resolve is an evil.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Sleep over such (actions) as may be slept over; (but) never over such as may not be slept over.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Whenever it is possible (to overcome your enemy) the act (of fighting) is certainly good; if not  endeavour to employ some more successful method.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Reflect on this: Both efforts and enemies  if left unfinished  Can destroy like an unextinguished fire.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Before acting resolve all doubts through consideration of these five: Cost  means  time  place and the action itself.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Discern a deeds outcome  obstacles and opulent earnings Successful effort affirms  then act.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The way to accomplish any task is to ascertain The inmost thoughts of an expert in that task.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Just as one elephant may be used to tether another  So one task may be the means of accomplishing another.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: Rather than bestow kind favors on friends  Hasten to befriend your unkind enemies.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: Fearing their peoples inner apprehensions  Men of minor realms bow before mightier rulers  accepting terms.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about love! Love makes us feel warm and happy, like a big hug from someone special. We should show love to our family and friends!
all_explanations.original_english: The qualification of an ambassador are affection (for his relations) a fitting birth  and the possession of attributes pleasing to royalty.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: Love (to his sovereign)  knowledge (of his afairs)  and a discriminating power of speech (before other sovereigns) are the three sine qua non qualifications of an ambassador.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: To be powerful in politics among those who are learned (in ethics) is the character of him who speaks to lancebearing kings on matters of triumph (to his own sovereign).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: He may go on a mission (to foreign rulers) who has combined in him all these three. viz.  (natural) sense  an attractive bearing and welltried learning.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: He is an ambassador who (in the presence of foreign rulers) speaks briefly  avoids harshness  talks so as to make them smile  and thus brings good (to his own sovereign).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: He is an ambassador who having studied (politics) talks impressively  is not afraid of angry looks  and knows (to employ) the art suited to the time.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: He is chief (among ambassadors) who understands the proper decorum (before foreign princes)  seeks the (proper) occasion  knows the (most suitable) place  and delivers his message after (due) consideration.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us to always tell the truth! Being honest is like being a superhero - it takes courage, but it's always the right thing to do!
all_explanations.original_english: The qualifications of him who faithfully delivers his (sovereigns) message are purity  the support (of foreign ministers)  and boldness  with truthfulness in addition to the (aforesaid) three.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: He alone is fit to communicate (his sovereigns) reply  who possesses the firmness not to utter even inadvertently what may reflect discredit (on the latter).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: He is the ambassador who fearlessly seeks his sovereigns good though it should cost him his life (to deliver his message).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Ministers who serve under fickleminded monarchs should  like those who warm themselves at the fire  be neither (too) far  nor (too) near.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: For ministers not to cover the things desired by their kings will through the kings themselves yield them everlasting wealth.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: Ministers who would save themselves should avoid (the commission of) serious errors for if the kings suspicion is once roused  no one can remove it.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: While in the presence of the sovereign  ministers should neither whisper to nor smile at others.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: (When the king is engaged) in secret counsel (with others)  ministers should neither overhear anything whatever nor pry into it with inquisitive questions  but (wait to) listen when it is divulged (by the king himself).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: Knowing the (kings disposition and seeking the right time  (the minister) should in a pleasing manner suggest things such as are desirable and not disagreeable.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Ministers should (always) give agreeable advice but on no occasion recommend useless actions  though requested (to do so).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about family and home. Our family loves us and takes care of us, just like a bird's nest keeps baby birds safe and warm!
all_explanations.original_english: Ministers should behave in accordance with the (Divine) light in the person of kings and not despise them saying  He is our junior (in age) and connected with our family!.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: Those whose judgement is firm will not do what is disagreeable (to the sovereign) saying (within themselves) We are esteemed by the king .

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: The (foolish) claim with which a minister does unbecoming acts because of his (long) familiarity (with the king) will ensure his ruin.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: The minister who by looking (at the king) understands his mind without being told (of it)  will be a perpetual ornament to the world which is surrounded by a neverdrying sea.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about God and how important it is to remember Him. Just like we remember our parents who love us, we should remember God who created everything!
all_explanations.original_english: He is to be esteemed a god who is able to ascertain without a doubt what is within (ones mind).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: The king should ever give whatever (is asked) of his belongings and secure him who  by the indications (of his own mind) is able to read those of another.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Those who understand ones thoughts without being informed (thereof) and those who do not  may (indeed) resemble one another bodily; still are they different (mentally).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Of what use are the eyes amongst ones members  if they cannot by their own indications dive those of another ?.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: As the mirror reflects what is near so does the face show what is uppermost in the mind.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: Is there anything so full of knowledge as the face ? (No.) it precedes the mind  whether (the latter is) pleased or vexed.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: If the king gets those who by looking into his mind can understand (and remove) what has occurred (to him) it is enough that he stand looking at their face.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: If a king gets ministers who can read the movements of the eye  the eyes (of foreign kings) will (themselves) reveal (to him) their hatred or friendship.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The measuringrod of those (ministers) who say we are acute will on inquiry be found to be their (own) eyes and nothing else.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Let the pure who know the arrangement of words speak with deliberation after ascertaining (the nature of) the court (then assembled).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: Let the good who know the uses of words speak with a clear knowledge after ascertaining the time (suited to the court).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: Those who undertake to speak without knowing the (nature of the) court are ignorant of the quality of words as well as devoid of the power (of learning).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Ministers should be lights in the assembly of the enlightned  but assume the pure whiteness of mortar (ignorance) in that of fools.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: The modesty by which one does not rush forward and speak in (an assembly of) superiors is the best among all (ones) good qualities.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: (For a minister) to blunder in the presence of those who have acquired a vast store of learning and know (the value thereof) is like a good man stumbling (and falling away) from the path (of virtue).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: The learning of those who have read and understood (much) will shine in the assembly of those who faultlessly examine (the nature of) words.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Lecturing to those who have the ability to understand (for themselves) is like watering a bed of plants that are growing (of themselves).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Those who are able to speak good things impressively in an assembly of the good should not even forgetfully speak them in that of the low

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: To utter (a good word) in the assembly of those who are of inferior rank is like dropping nectar on the ground.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The pure who know the class ification of words having first ascertained the nature (of the court) will not (through fear) falter in their speech before the powerful body.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: Those who can agreeably set forth their acquirements before the learned will be regarded as the most learned among the learned.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: Many indeed may (fearlessly) die in the presence of (their) foes; (but) few are those who are fearless in the assembly (of the learned).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: (Ministers) should agreeably set forth their acquirements before the learned and acquire more (know ledge) from their superiors (in learning).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: In order to reply fearlessly before a foreign court  (ministers) should learn logic according to the rules (of grammar).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: What have they to do with a sword who are not valiant  or they with learning who are afraid of an intelligent assembly ?

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: The learning of him who is diffident before an assembly is like the shining sword of an hermaphrodite in the presence of his foes.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Those who cannot agreeably speak good things before a good assembly are indeed unprofitable persons inspite of all their various acquirements.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: They who  though they have learned and understood  are yet afraid of the assembly of the good  are said to be inferior (even) to the illiterate.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: Those who through fear of the assembly are unable to set forth theirlearning in an interesting manner  though alive  are yet like the dead.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: A kingdom is that in which (those who carry on) a complete cultivation  virtuous persons  and merchants with inexhaustible wealth  dwell together.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: A kingdom is that which is desire for its immense wealth  and which grows greatly in prosperity  being free from destructive causes.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: A kingdom is that which can bear any burden that may be pressed on it (from adjoining kingdoms) and (yet) pay the full tribute to its sovereign.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: A kingdom is that which continues to be free from excessive starvation  irremediable epidemics  and destructive foes.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: A kingdom is that which is without various (irregular) associations  destructive internal enemies  and murderous savages who (sometimes) harass the sovereign.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: The learned say that the best kingdom is that which knows no evil (from its foes)  and  if injured (at all)  sufers no diminution in its fruitfulness.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: The constituents of a kingdom are the two waters (from above and below)  well situated hills and an undestructible fort.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: Freedom from epidemics  wealth  produce  happiness and protection (to subjects); these five  the learned  say  are the ornaments of a kingdom.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: The learned say that those are kingdom whose wealth is not laboured for  and those not  whose wealth is only obtained through labour.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us not to hurt others. We should be gentle and kind, just like we want others to be gentle and kind to us!
all_explanations.original_english: Although in possession of all the above mentioned excellences  these are indeed of no use to a country  in the absence of harmony between the sovereign and the sujects.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: A fort is an object of importance to those who march (against their foes) as well as to those who through fear (of pursuers) would seek it for shelter.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: A fort is that which has everlasting water  plains  mountains and cool shady forests.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: The learned say that a fortress is an enclosure having these four (qualities) viz.  height  breadth  strength and inaccessibility.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: A fort is that which has an extensive space within  but only small places to be guarded  and such as can destroy the courage of besieging foes.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: A fort is that which cannot be captured  which abounds in suitable provisions  and afords a position of easy defence to its inmates.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: A fort is that which has all (needful) things  and excellent heroes that can help it against destruction (by foes).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: A fort is that which cannot be captured by blockading  assaulting  or undermining it.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: That is a fort whose inmates are able to overcome without losing their ground  even abler men who have besieged it.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: A fort is that which derives excellence from the stratagems made (by its inmates) to defeat their enemies in the battlefield.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Although a fort may possess all (the above-said) excellence  it is  as it were without these  if its inmates possess not the excellence of action.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about money and things we own. It's good to have what we need, but it's even better to share with others who don't have enough!
all_explanations.original_english: Besides wealth there is nothing that can change people of no importance into those of (some) importance.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about money and things we own. It's good to have what we need, but it's even better to share with others who don't have enough!
all_explanations.original_english: All despise the poor; (but) all praise the rich.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about money and things we own. It's good to have what we need, but it's even better to share with others who don't have enough!
all_explanations.original_english: The imperishable light of wealth goes into regions desired (by its owner) and destroys the darkness (of enmity therein).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: The wealth acquired with a knowledge of the proper means and without foul practices will yield virtue and happiness.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: (Kings) should rather avoid than seek the accumulation of wealth which does not flow in with mercy and love.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: Unclaimed wealth  wealth acquired by taxes  and wealth (got) by conquest of foes are (all) the wealth of the king.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about money and things we own. It's good to have what we need, but it's even better to share with others who don't have enough!
all_explanations.original_english: The child mercy which is borne by love grows under the care of the rich nurse of wealth.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: An undertaking of one who has wealth in ones hands is like viewing an elephant-fight from a hill-top.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about money and things we own. It's good to have what we need, but it's even better to share with others who don't have enough!
all_explanations.original_english: Accumulate wealth; it will destroy the arrogance of (your) foes; there is no weapon sharper than it.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: To those who have honestly acquired an abundance of riches  the other two  (virtue and pleasure) are things easy (of acquisition).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: The army which is complete in (its) parts and conquers without fear of wounds is the chief wealth of the king.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: Ancient army can alone have the valour which makes it stand by its king at the time of defeat  fearless of wounds and unmindful of its reduced strength.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: What if (a host of) hostile rats roar like the sea ? They will perish at the mere breath of the cobra.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: That indeed is an army which has stood firm of old without sufering destruction or deserting (to the enemy).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: That indeed is an army which is capable of ofering a united resistance  even if Yama advances against it with fury.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Valour  honour  following in the excellent-footsteps (of its predecessors) and trust-worthiness; these four alone constitute the safeguard of an army.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: That is an army which knowing the art of warding of an impending struggle  can bear against the dust-van (of a hostile force).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Though destitute of courage to fight and strength (to endure)  an army may yet gain renown by the splendour of its appearance.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural reminds us to help people who don't have enough. When we share our lunch with a friend who forgot theirs, we're being kind and helpful!
all_explanations.original_english: An army can triumph (over its foes) if it is free from diminution; irremediable aversion and poverty.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Though an army may contain a large number of permanent soldiers  itcannot last if it has no generals.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: O my foes  stand not before my leader; (for) many are those who did so but afterwards stood (in the shape of) statues.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: It is more pleasant to hold the dart that has missed an elephant than that which has hit hare in the forest.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: The learned say that fierceness (incontest with a foe) is indeed great valour; but to become a benefactor in case of accident (to a foe) is the extreme (limit) of that valour.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The hero who after casting the lance in his hand on an elephant  comes (in search of another) will pluck the one (that sticks) in his body and laugh (exultingly).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Is it not a defeat to the valiant to wink and destroy their ferocious look when a lance in cast at them (by their foe) ?

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The hero will reckon among wasted days all those on which he had not received severe wounds.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The fastening of ankle-ring by those who disire a world-wide renown and not (the safety of) their lives is like adorning (themselves).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: The heroes who are not afraid of losing their life in a contest will not cool their ardour  even if the king prohibits (their fighting).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Who would reproach with failure those who seal their oath with their death ?

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: If (heroes) can so die as to fill with tears the eyes of their rulers  such a death deserves to be obtained even by begging.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: What things are there so dificult to acquire as friendship ? What guards are there so dificult to break through by the efforts (of ones foes) ?

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: The friendship of the wise waxes like the new moon; (but) that of fools wanes like the full moon.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: Like learning  the friendship of the noble  the more it is cultivated  the more delightful does it become.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: Friendship is to be practised not for the purpose of laughing but for that of being beforehand in giving one another sharp rebukes in case of transgression.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: Living together and holding frequent intercourse are not necessary (for friendship); (mutual) understanding can alone create a claim for it.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: The love that dwells (merely in the smiles of the face is not friendship; (but) that which dwells deep in the smiles of the heart is true friendship.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: (True) friendship turns aside from evil (ways) makes (him) walk in the (good) way  and  in case of loss if shares his sorrow (with him).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: (True) friendship hastens to the rescue of the afflicted (as readily) as the hand of one whose garment is loosened (before an assembly).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Friendship may be said to be on its throne when it possesses the power of supporting one at all times and under all circumstances  (in the practice or virtue and wealth).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: Though friends may praise one another saying  He is so intimate with us  and we so much (with him); (still) such friendship will appear mean.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: As those who are of a friendly nature will not forsake (a friend) after once loving (him)  there is no evil so great as contracting a friendship without due inquiry.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: The friendship contracted by him who has not made repeated inquiry will in the end grieve (him) to death.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: Make friendship (with one) after ascertaining (his) character  birth  defects and the whole of ones relations.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: The friendship of one who belongs to a (good) family and is afraid of (being charged with) guilt  is worth even purchasing.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: You should examine and secure the friendship of those who can speak so as to make you weep over a crime (before its commission) or rebuke you severely (after you have done it) and are able to teach you (the ways of) the world.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Even in ruin there is some good; (for) it is a rod by which one may measure fully (the afection of ones) relations.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: It is indead a gain for one to renounce the friendship of fools.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: Do not think of things that discourage your mind  nor contract friendship with those who would forsake you in adversity.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: The very thought of the friendship of those who have deserted one at the approach of adversity will burn ones mind at the time of death.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: Continue to enjoy the friendship of the pure; (but) renounce even with a gift  the friendship of those who do not agree (with the world).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
