all_explanations.original_english: Imtimate friendship is that which cannot in the least be injured by (things done through the) right (of longstanding intimacy).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: The constituents of friendship are (things done through) the right of intimacy; to be pleased with such a right is the duty of the wise.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: Of what avail is long-standing friendship  if friends do not admit as their own actions done through the right of intimacy ?

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: If friends  through the right of friendship  do (anything) without being asked  the wise will be pleased with them on account of its desirability.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: If friends should perform what is painful  understand that it is owing not only to ignorance  but also to the strong claims of intimacy.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: Those who stand within the limits (of true friendship) will not even in adversity give up the intimacy of long-standing friends.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: Those who have (long) stood in the path of afection will not give it up even if their friends cause (them) their ruin.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: To those who understand that by which they should not listen to (tales about) the faults of their friends  that is a (profitable) day on which the latter may commit a fault.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: They will be loved by the world  who have not forsaken the friendship of those with whom they have kept up an unbroken long-standing intimacy.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: Even enemies will love those who have never changed in their affection to their long-standing friends.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: The decrease of friendship with those who look as if they would eat you up (through excess of love) while they are really destitute of goodness is far better than its increase.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: Of what avail is it to get or lose the friendship of those who love when there is gain and leave when there is none ?

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: Friendship who calculate the profits (of their friendship)  prostitutes who are bent on obtaining their gains  and thieves are (all) of the same character.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Solitude is more to be desired than the society of those who resemble the untrained horses which throw down (their riders) in the fields of battle.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: It is far better to avoid that to contract the evil friendship of the base who cannot protect (their friends) even when appointed to do so.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The hatred of the wise is ten-million times more profitable than the excessive intimacy of the fool.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: What comes from enemies is a hundred million times more profitable than what comes from the friendship of those who cause only laughter.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: Gradually abandon without revealing (beforehand) the friendship of those who pretend inability to carry out what they (really) could do.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: The friendship of those whose actions do not agree with their words will distress (one) even in (ones) dreams.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: Avoid even the least approach to a contraction of friendship with those who would love you in private but ridicule you in public.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: The friendship of those who behave like friends without inward afection is a weapon that may be thrown when a favourable opportunity presents itself.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: The friendship of those who seem to be friends while they are not  will change like the love of women.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Though (ones) enemies may have mastered many good books  it will be impossible for them to become truly loving at heart.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about love! Love makes us feel warm and happy, like a big hug from someone special. We should show love to our family and friends!
all_explanations.original_english: One should fear the deceitful who smile sweetly with their face but never love with their heart.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about love! Love makes us feel warm and happy, like a big hug from someone special. We should show love to our family and friends!
all_explanations.original_english: In nothing whatever is it proper to rely on the words of those who do not love with their heart.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Though (ones) foes may utter good things as though they were friends  once will at once understand (their evil  import).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Since the bending of the bow bespeaks evil  one should not accept (as good) the humiliating speeches of one s foes.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: A weapon may be hid in the very hands with which (ones) foes adore (him) (and) the tears they shed are of the same nature.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: It is the duty of kings to afect great love but make it die (inwardly); as regard those foes who shew them great friendship but despise them (in their heart).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: When ones foes begin to affect friendship  one should love them with ones looks  and  cherishing no love in the heart  give up (even the former).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Folly is one (of the chief defects); it is that which (makes one) incur loss and forego gain.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The greatest folly is that which leads one to take delight in doing what is forbidden.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Shamelessness indifference (to what must be sought after)  harshness  and aversion for everything (that ought to be desired) are the qualities of the fool.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: There are no greater fools than he who  though he has read and understood (a great deal) and even taught it to others  does not walk according to his own teaching.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: A fool can procure in a single birth a hell into which he may enter and sufer through all the seven births.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: If the fool  who knows not how to act undertakes a work  he will (certainly) fail. (But) is it all ? He will even adorn himself with fetters.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: If a fool happens to get an immense fortune  his neighbours will enjoy it while his relations starve.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: A fool happening to possess something is like the intoxication of one who is (already) giddy.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: The friendship between fools is exceedingly delightful (to each other): for at parting there will be nothing to cause them pain.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: The appearance of a fool in an assembly of the learned is like placing (ones) unwashed feet on a bed.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: The want of wisdom is the greatest of all wants; but that of wealth the world will not regard as such.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: (The cause of) a fool cheerfully giving (something) is nothing else but the receivers merit (in a former birth).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The suffering that fools inflict upon themselves is hardly possible even to foes.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: What is called want of wisdom is the vanity which says  We are wise.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Fools pretending to know what has not been read (by them) will rouse suspicion even as to what they have thoroughly mastered.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: Even to cover ones nakedness would be folly  if (ones) faults were not covered (by forsaking them).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The fool who neglects precious counsel does  of his own accord  a great injury to himself.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The fool will not perform (his duties) even when advised nor ascertain them himself; such a soul is a burden (to the earth) till it departs (from the body).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: One who would teach a fool will (simply) betray his folly; and the fool would (still) think himself wise in his own conceit.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us to always tell the truth! Being honest is like being a superhero - it takes courage, but it's always the right thing to do!
all_explanations.original_english: He who denies the existence of what the world believes in will be regarded as a demon on earth.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us not to hurt others. We should be gentle and kind, just like we want others to be gentle and kind to us!
all_explanations.original_english: The disease which fosters the evil of disunion among all creatures is termed hatred by the wise.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Though disagreeable things may be done from (a feeling of) disunion  it is far better that nothing painful be done from (that of) hatred.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: To rid one-self of the distressing dtsease of hatred will bestow (on one) a never-decreasing imperishable fame.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: If hatred which is the greatest misery is destroyed  it will yield the greatest delight.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Who indeed would think of conquering those who naturally shrink back from hatred ?

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Failure and ruin are not far from him who says it is sweet to excel in hatred.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us to always tell the truth! Being honest is like being a superhero - it takes courage, but it's always the right thing to do!
all_explanations.original_english: Those whose judgement brings misery through its connection with hatred cannot understand the triumphant nature of truth.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: Shrinking back from hatred will yield wealth; indulging in its increase will hasten ruin.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about money and things we own. It's good to have what we need, but it's even better to share with others who don't have enough!
all_explanations.original_english: At the approach of wealth one will not think of hatred (but) to secure ones ruin  one will look to its increase.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: All calamities are caused by hatred; but by the delight (of friendship) is caused the great wealth of good virtues.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Avoid offering resistance to the strong; (but) never fail to cherish enmity towards the weak.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: How can he who is unloving  destitute of powerful aids  and himself without strength overcome the might of his foe ?

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: In the estimation of foes miserably weak is he  who is timid  ignorant  unsociable and niggardly.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us not to get too angry. When we're angry, we should take deep breaths and calm down, just like counting to ten before we speak!
all_explanations.original_english: He who neither refrains from anger nor keeps his secrets will at all times and in all places be easily conquered by all.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: (A) pleasing (object) to his foes is he who reads not moral works  does nothing that is enjoined by them cares not for reproach and is not possessed of good qualities.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us not to get too angry. When we're angry, we should take deep breaths and calm down, just like counting to ten before we speak!
all_explanations.original_english: Highly to be desired is the hatred of him whose anger is blind  and whose lust increases beyond measure.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural reminds us to help people who don't have enough. When we share our lunch with a friend who forgot theirs, we're being kind and helpful!
all_explanations.original_english: It is indeed necessary to obtain even by purchase the hatred of him who having begun (a work) does what is not conductive (to its accomplishment).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: He will become friendless who is without (any good) qualities. and whose faults are many; (such a character) is a help to (his) foes.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: There will be no end of lofty delights to the victorious  if their foes are (both) ignorant and timid.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: The light (of fame) will never be gained by him who gains not the trifling reputation of having fought an unlearned (foe).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us not to hurt others. We should be gentle and kind, just like we want others to be gentle and kind to us!
all_explanations.original_english: The evil of hatred is not of a nature to be desired by one even in sport.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Though you may incur the hatred of warriors whose ploughs are bows  incur not that of ministers whose ploughs are words.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: He who being alone  incurs the hatred of many is more infatuated than even mad men.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: The world abides in the greatness of that good-natured man who behaves so as to turn hatred into friendship.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: He who is alone and helpless while his foes are two should secure of them as an agreeable help one (to himself).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Though (ones foe is) aware or not of ones misfortune one should act so as neither to join nor separate (from him).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: Relate not your sufering even to friends who are ignorant of it  nor refer to your weakness in the presence of your foes.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The joy of ones foes will be destroyed if one guards oneself by knowing the way (of acting) and securing assistance.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: A thorny tree should be felled while young  (for) when it is grown it will destroy the hand of the feller.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Those who do not destroy the pride of those who hate (them) will certainly not exist even to breathe.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Shade and water are not pleasant  (if) they cause disease; so are the qualities of (ones) relations not agreeable  (if) they cause pain.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: Fear not foes (who say they would cut) like a sword; (but) fear the friendship of foes (who seemingly act) like relations.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us not to hurt others. We should be gentle and kind, just like we want others to be gentle and kind to us!
all_explanations.original_english: Fear internal enmity and guard yourself; (if not) it will destroy (you) in an evil hour  as surely as the tool which cuts the potters clay.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us not to hurt others. We should be gentle and kind, just like we want others to be gentle and kind to us!
all_explanations.original_english: The secret enmity of a person whose mind in unreformed will lead to many evils causing disafection among (ones) relations.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about family and home. Our family loves us and takes care of us, just like a bird's nest keeps baby birds safe and warm!
all_explanations.original_english: If there appears internal hatred in a (kings) family; it will lead to many a fatal crime.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: If hatred arises among (ones) own people  it will be hardly possible (for one) to escape death.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about family and home. Our family loves us and takes care of us, just like a bird's nest keeps baby birds safe and warm!
all_explanations.original_english: Never indeed will a family subject to internal hatred unite (really) though it may present an apparent union like that of a casket and its lid.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about family and home. Our family loves us and takes care of us, just like a bird's nest keeps baby birds safe and warm!
all_explanations.original_english: A family subject to internal hatred will wear out and lose its strength like iron that has been filed away.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Although internal hatred be as small as the fragment of the sesamum (seed)  still does destruction dwell in it.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Living with those who do not agree (with one) is like dwelling with a cobra (in the same) hut.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us not to hurt others. We should be gentle and kind, just like we want others to be gentle and kind to us!
all_explanations.original_english: Not to disregard the power of those who can carry out (their wishes) is more important than all the watchfulness of those who guard (themselves against evil).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: To behave without respect for the great (rulers) will make them do (us) irremediable evils.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: If a person desires ruin  let him not listen to the righteous dictates of law  but commit crimes against those who are able to slay (other sovereigns).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us not to hurt others. We should be gentle and kind, just like we want others to be gentle and kind to us!
all_explanations.original_english: The weak doing evil to the strong is like beckoning Yama to come (and destroy them).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us not to get too angry. When we're angry, we should take deep breaths and calm down, just like counting to ten before we speak!
all_explanations.original_english: Those who have incurred the wrath of a cruel and mighty potentate will not prosper wherever they may go.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Though burnt by a fire (from a forest)  one may perhaps live; (but) never will he live who has shown disrespect to the great (devotees).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: If a king incurs the wrath of the righteous great  what will become of his government with its splendid auxiliaries and (all) its untold wealth ?

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: If (the) hill-like (devotees) resolve on destruction  those who seemed to be everlasting will be destroyed root and branch from the earth.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: If those of exalted vows burst in a rage  even (Indra) the king will sufer a sudden loss and be entirely ruined.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us not to get too angry. When we're angry, we should take deep breaths and calm down, just like counting to ten before we speak!
all_explanations.original_english: Though in possession of numerous auxiliaries  they will perish who are-exposed to the wrath of the noble whose penance is boundless.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Those who lust after their wives will not attain the excellence of virtue and it is just this that is not desired by those who are bent on acquiring wealth.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about family and home. Our family loves us and takes care of us, just like a bird's nest keeps baby birds safe and warm!
all_explanations.original_english: The wealth of him who  regardless (of his manliness)  devotes himself to his wifes feminine nature will cause great shame (to ali men) and to himself

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: The frailty that stoops to a wife will always make (her husband) feel ashamed among the good.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about family and home. Our family loves us and takes care of us, just like a bird's nest keeps baby birds safe and warm!
all_explanations.original_english: The undertaking of one  who fears his wife and is therefore destitute of (bliss)  will never be applauded.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: He that fears his wife will always be afraid of doing good deeds (even) to the good.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about God and how important it is to remember Him. Just like we remember our parents who love us, we should remember God who created everything!
all_explanations.original_english: They that fear the bamboo like shoulders of their wives will be destitute of manliness though they may flourish like the Gods.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about family and home. Our family loves us and takes care of us, just like a bird's nest keeps baby birds safe and warm!
all_explanations.original_english: Even shame faced womanhood is more to be esteemed than the shameless manhood that performs the behests of a wife.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: Those who yield to the wishes of their wives will neither relieve the wants of (their) friends nor perform virtuous deeds.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: From those who obey the commands of their wives are to be expected neither deeds of virtue  nor those of wealth nor (even) those of pleasure.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about family and home. Our family loves us and takes care of us, just like a bird's nest keeps baby birds safe and warm!
all_explanations.original_english: The foolishness that results from devotion to a wife will never be found in those who possess a reflecting mind and a prosperity (flowing) therefrom.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The sweet words of elegant braceleted (prostitutes) who desire (a man) not from afection but from avarice  will cause sorrow.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: One must ascertain the character of the ill natured women who after ascertaining the wealth (of a man) speak (as if they were) good natured ones  and avoid intercourse (with them).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about money and things we own. It's good to have what we need, but it's even better to share with others who don't have enough!
all_explanations.original_english: The false embraces of wealth loving women are like (hired men) embracing astrange corpse in a dark room.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about money and things we own. It's good to have what we need, but it's even better to share with others who don't have enough!
all_explanations.original_english: The wise who seek the wealth of grace will not desire the base favours of those who regard wealth (and not pleasure) as (their) riches.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: Those whose knowledge is made excellent by their (natural) sense will not covet the trfling delights of those whose favours are common (to all).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Those who would spread (the fame of) their own goodness will not desire the shoulders of those who rejoice in their accomplishments and bestow their despicable favours (on all who pay).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Those who are destitute of a perfectly (reformed) mind will covet the shoulders of those who embrace (them) while their hearts covet other things.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The wise say that to such as are destitute of discerning sense the embraces of faithless women are (as ruinous as those of) the celestail female.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The delicate shoulders of prostitutes with excellent jewels are a hell into which are plunged the ignorant base

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Treacherous women  liquor  and gambling are the associates of such as have forsaken by Fortune.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Those who always thirst after drink will neither inspire fear (in others) nor retain the light (of their fame).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Let no liquor be drunk if it is desired  let it be drunk by those who care not for esteem of the great.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Intoxication is painful even in the presence of (ones) mother what will it not then be in that of the wise ?

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The fair maid of modesty will turn her back on those who are guilty of the great and abominable crime of drunkenness.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about money and things we own. It's good to have what we need, but it's even better to share with others who don't have enough!
all_explanations.original_english: To give money and purchase unconsciousness is the result of ones ignorance of (ones own actions).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: They that sleep resemble the deed (likewise) they that drink are no other than poison eaters.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Those who always intoxicate themselves by a private (indulgence in) drink will have their secrets detected and laughed at by their fellow townsmen.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Let (the drunkard) give up saying  I have never drunk (for) the moment (he drinks) he will simply betray his former attempt to conceal.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Reasoning with a drunkard is like going under water with a torch in search of a drowned man.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us not to hurt others. We should be gentle and kind, just like we want others to be gentle and kind to us!
all_explanations.original_english: When (a drunkard) who is sober sees one who is not  it looks as if he remembered not the evil efects of his (own) drink.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Though able to win  let not one desire gambling (for) even what is won is like a fish swallowing the iron in fishhook.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Is there indeed a means of livelihood that can bestow happiness on gamblers who gain one and lose a hundred ?

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: If the king is incessantly addicted to the rolling dice in the hope of gain  his wealth and the resources thereof will take their departure and fall into others hands.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural reminds us to help people who don't have enough. When we share our lunch with a friend who forgot theirs, we're being kind and helpful!
all_explanations.original_english: There is nothing else that brings (us) poverty like gambling which causes many a misery and destroys (ones) reputation.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Penniless are those who by reason of their attachment would never forsake gambling  the gambling place and the handling (of dice).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about God and how important it is to remember Him. Just like we remember our parents who love us, we should remember God who created everything!
all_explanations.original_english: Those who are swallowed by the goddess called  gambling will never have their hunger satisfied  but suffer the pangs of hell in the next world.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: To waste time at the place of gambling will destroy inherited wealth and goodness of character.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Gambling destroys property  teaches falsehood  puts an end to benevolence  and brings in misery (here and hereafter).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: The habit of gambling prevents the attainment of these five: clothing  wealth  food  fame and learning.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about love! Love makes us feel warm and happy, like a big hug from someone special. We should show love to our family and friends!
all_explanations.original_english: As the gambler loves (his vice) the more he loses by it  so does the soul love (the body) the more it suffers through it.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: If (food and work are either) excessive or deficient  the three things enumerated by (medical) writers  flatulence  biliousness  and phlegm  will cause (one) disease.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: No medicine is necessary for him who eats after assuring (himself) that what he has (already) eaten has been digested.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: If (ones food has been) digested let one eat with moderation (for) that is the way to prolong the life of an embodied soul.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: (First) assure yourself that your food has been digested and never fail to eat  when very hungry  whatever is not disagreeable (to you).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: There will be no disaster to ones life if one eats with moderation  food that is not disagreeable.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: As pleasure dwells with him who eats moderately  so disease (dwells) with the glutton who eats voraciously.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: He will be aflicted with numberless diseases  who eats immoderately  ignorant (of the rules of health).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Let the physician enquire into the (nature of the) disease  its cause and its method of cure and treat it faithfully according to (medical rule).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: The learned (physician) should ascertain the condition of his patient the nature of his disease  and the season (of the year) and (then) proceed (with his treatment).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Medical science consists of four parts  viz.  patient  physician  medicine and compounder and each of these (again) contains four subdivisions.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Consistency (of thought  word and deed) and fear (of sin) are conjointly natural only to the highborn.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: The highborn will never deviate from these three good manners  truthfulness and modesty.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us not to hurt others. We should be gentle and kind, just like we want others to be gentle and kind to us!
all_explanations.original_english: A cheerful countenance  liberality  pleasant words  and an unreviling disposition  these four are said to be the proper qualities of the truly highborn.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about money and things we own. It's good to have what we need, but it's even better to share with others who don't have enough!
all_explanations.original_english: Though blessed with immense wealth  the noble will never do anything unbecoming.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us to always tell the truth! Being honest is like being a superhero - it takes courage, but it's always the right thing to do!
all_explanations.original_english: Though their means fall off  those born in ancient families  will not lose their character (for liberality).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us to always tell the truth! Being honest is like being a superhero - it takes courage, but it's always the right thing to do!
all_explanations.original_english: Those who seek to preserve the irreproachable honour of their families will not viciously do what is detrimental thereto.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The defects of the noble will be observed as clearly as the dark spots in the moon.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: If one of a good family betrays want of affection  his descent from it will be called in question.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: As the sprout indicates the nature of the soil  (so) the speech of the noble indicates (that of ones birth).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: He who desires a good name must desire modesty and he who desires (the continuance of) a family greatness must be submissive to all.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about family and home. Our family loves us and takes care of us, just like a bird's nest keeps baby birds safe and warm!
all_explanations.original_english: Actions that would degrade (ones) family should not be done though they may be so important that not doing them would end in death.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Those who desire (to maintain their) honour  will surely do nothing dishonourable  even for the sake of fame.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: In great prosperity humility is becoming dignity  in great adversity.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: They who have fallen from their (high) position are like the hair which has fallen from the head.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Even those who are exalted like a hill will be thought low  if they commit deeds that are debasing.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Of what good is it (for the highborn) to go and stand in vain before those who revile him ? it only brings him loss of honour and exclusion from heaven.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: It is better for a man to be said of him that he died in his usual state than that he eked out his life by following those who disgraced him.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: For the highborn to keep their body in life when their honour is gone will certainly not prove a remedy against death.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Those who give up (their) life when (their) honour is at stake are like the yark which kills itself at the loss of (even one of) its hairs.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The world will (always) praise and adore the fame of the honourable who would rather die than sufer indignity.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Ones light is the abundance of ones courage ones darkness is the desire to live destitute of such (a state of mind.)

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: All human beings agree as regards their birth but difer as regards their characteristics  because of the d ifferent qualities of their actions.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Though (raised) above  the base cannot become great though (brought) low the great cannot become base.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Even greatness  like a womans chastity  belongs only to him who guards himself.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: (Though reduced) the great will be able to perform  in the proper way  deeds dificult (for others to do).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: It is never in the nature of the base to seek the society of the great and partake of their nature.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural tells us that learning is very important! Just like you learn new things in school every day, we should always keep learning to become smarter and kinder.
all_explanations.original_english: Even nobility of birth  wealth and learning  if in (the possession of) the base  will (only) produce everincreasing pride.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The great will always humble himself but the mean will exalt himself in selfadmiration.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Freedom from conceit is (the nature of true) greatness (while) obstinacy therein is (that of) meanness.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The great hide the faults of others the base only divulge them.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: It is said that those who are conscious of their duty and behave with a perfect goodness will regard as natu ral all that is good.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: The only delight of the perfect is that of their goodness all other (sensual) delights are not to be included among any (true) delights.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Affection  fear (of sin)  benevolence  favour and truthfulness these perfect are the five pillars on which goodness rests.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Penance consists in the goodness that kills not   and perfection in the goodness that tells not others faults.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: Stooping (to inferiors) is the strength of those who can accomplish (an undertaking) and that is the weapon with which the great avert their foes.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The touchstone of perfection is to receive a defeat even at the hands of ones inferiors.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Of what avail is perfect goodness if it cannot do pleasing things even to those who have pained (it) ?

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Poverty is no disgrace to one who abounds in good qualities.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Those who are said to be the shore of the sea of perfection will never change  though ages may change.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: If there is a defect in the character of the perfect  (even) the great world cannot bear (its) burden.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: If one is easy of access to all  it will be easy for one to obtain the virtue called goodness.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Affectionateness and birth in a good family  these two constitute what is called a proper behaviour to all.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Resemblance of bodies is no resemblance of souls true resemblance is the resemblance of qualities that attract.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The world applauds the character of those whose usefulness results from their equity and charity.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Reproach is painful to one even in sport those (therefore) who know the nature of others exhibit (pleasing) qualities even when they are hated.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: The (way of the) world subsists by contact with the good if not  it would bury itself in the earth and perish.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: He who is destitute of (true) human qualities (only) resembles a tree  though he may possess the sharpness of a file.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: It is wrong (for the wise) not to exhibit (good) qualities even towards those who bearing no friendship (for them) do only what is hateful.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: To those who cannot rejoice  the wide world is buried darkness even in (broad) day light.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: The great wealth obtained by one who has no goodness will perish like pure milk spoilt by the impurity of the vessel.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about money and things we own. It's good to have what we need, but it's even better to share with others who don't have enough!
all_explanations.original_english: He who does not enjoy the immense riches he has heaped up in his house  is (to be reckoned as) dead  (for) there is nothing achieved (by him).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about money and things we own. It's good to have what we need, but it's even better to share with others who don't have enough!
all_explanations.original_english: He who knows that wealth yields every pleasure and yet is so blind as to lead miserly life will be born a demon.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about money and things we own. It's good to have what we need, but it's even better to share with others who don't have enough!
all_explanations.original_english: A burden to the earth are men bent on the acquisition of riches and not (true) fame.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: What will the miser who is not liked (by any one) regard as his own (in the world to come) ?

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about money and things we own. It's good to have what we need, but it's even better to share with others who don't have enough!
all_explanations.original_english: Those who neither give (to others) nor enjoy (their property) are (truly) destitute  though possessing immense riches.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about money and things we own. It's good to have what we need, but it's even better to share with others who don't have enough!
all_explanations.original_english: He who enjoys not (his riches) nor relieves the wants of the worthy is a disease to his wealth.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about money and things we own. It's good to have what we need, but it's even better to share with others who don't have enough!
all_explanations.original_english: The wealth of him who never bestows anything on the destitute is like a woman of beauty growing old without a husband.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about money and things we own. It's good to have what we need, but it's even better to share with others who don't have enough!
all_explanations.original_english: The wealth of him who is disliked (by all) is like the fruitbearing of the etty tree in the midst of a town.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: Strangers will inherit the riches that have been acquired without regard for friendship  comfort and charity.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about money and things we own. It's good to have what we need, but it's even better to share with others who don't have enough!
all_explanations.original_english: The shortlived poverty of those who are noble and rich is like the clouds becoming poor (for a while).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us not to hurt others. We should be gentle and kind, just like we want others to be gentle and kind to us!
all_explanations.original_english: True modesty is the fear of (evil) deeds; all other modesty is (simply) the bashfulness of virtuous maids

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Food  clothing and the like are common to all men but modesty is peculiar to the good.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: As the body is the abode of the spirit  so the excellence of modesty is the abode of perfection.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Is not the modesty ornament of the noble ? Without it  their haughtiness would be a pain (to others).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The world regards as the abode of modesty him who fear his own and others guilt.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The great make modesty their barrier (of defence) and not the wide world.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The modest would rather lose their life for the sake of modesty than lose modesty for the sake of life.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Virtue is likely to forsake him who shamelessly does what others are ashamed of.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about family and home. Our family loves us and takes care of us, just like a bird's nest keeps baby birds safe and warm!
all_explanations.original_english: Want of manners injures ones family; but want of modesty injures ones character.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The actions of those who are without modesty at heart are like those of puppet moved by a string.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about family and home. Our family loves us and takes care of us, just like a bird's nest keeps baby birds safe and warm!
all_explanations.original_english: There is no higher greatness than that of one saying. I will not cease in my effort (to raise my family).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about family and home. Our family loves us and takes care of us, just like a bird's nest keeps baby birds safe and warm!
all_explanations.original_english: Ones family is raised by unti ring perseverance in both efort and wise contrivances.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about family and home. Our family loves us and takes care of us, just like a bird's nest keeps baby birds safe and warm!
all_explanations.original_english: The Deity will clothe itself and appear before him who resolves on raising his family.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about family and home. Our family loves us and takes care of us, just like a bird's nest keeps baby birds safe and warm!
all_explanations.original_english: Those who are prompt in their eforts (to better their family) need no deliberation  such eforts will of themselves succeed.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about family and home. Our family loves us and takes care of us, just like a bird's nest keeps baby birds safe and warm!
all_explanations.original_english: People will eagerly seek the friendship of the prosperous soul who has raised his family without foul means.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about family and home. Our family loves us and takes care of us, just like a bird's nest keeps baby birds safe and warm!
all_explanations.original_english: A mans true manliness consists in making himself the head and benefactor of his family.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about family and home. Our family loves us and takes care of us, just like a bird's nest keeps baby birds safe and warm!
all_explanations.original_english: Like heroes in the battlefield  the burden (of protection etc.) is borne by those who are the most eficient in a family.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: As a family sufers by (ones) indolence and false dignity there is to be so season (good or bad) to those who strive to raise their family.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about family and home. Our family loves us and takes care of us, just like a bird's nest keeps baby birds safe and warm!
all_explanations.original_english: Is it only to sufering that his body is exposed who undertakes to preserve his family from evil ?

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about family and home. Our family loves us and takes care of us, just like a bird's nest keeps baby birds safe and warm!
all_explanations.original_english: If there are none to prop up and maintain a family (in distress)  it will fall at the stroke of the axe of misfortune.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about farming and growing food! Farmers work hard to grow the food we eat. We should thank them and never waste food!
all_explanations.original_english: Agriculture  though laborious  is the most excellent (form of labour); for people  though they go about (in search of various employments)  have at last to resort to the farmer.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Agriculturists are (as it were) the linchpin of the world for they support all other workers who cannot till the soil.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about farming and growing food! Farmers work hard to grow the food we eat. We should thank them and never waste food!
all_explanations.original_english: They alone live who live by agriculture; all others lead a cringing  dependent life.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: Patriotic farmers desire to bring all other states under the control of their own king.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural reminds us to help people who don't have enough. When we share our lunch with a friend who forgot theirs, we're being kind and helpful!
all_explanations.original_english: Those whose nature is to live by manual labour will never beg but give something to those who beg.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about farming and growing food! Farmers work hard to grow the food we eat. We should thank them and never waste food!
all_explanations.original_english: If the farmers hands are slackened  even the ascetic state will fail.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: If the land is dried so as to reduce one ounce of earth to a quarter  it will grow plentifully even without a handful of manure.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Manuring is better than ploughing; after weeding  watching is better than watering (it).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about family and home. Our family loves us and takes care of us, just like a bird's nest keeps baby birds safe and warm!
all_explanations.original_english: If the owner does not (personally) attend to his cultivation  his land will behave like an angry wife and yield him no pleasure.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural reminds us to help people who don't have enough. When we share our lunch with a friend who forgot theirs, we're being kind and helpful!
all_explanations.original_english: The maiden  Earth  will laugh at the sight of those who plead poverty and lead an idle life.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural reminds us to help people who don't have enough. When we share our lunch with a friend who forgot theirs, we're being kind and helpful!
all_explanations.original_english: There is nothing that aflicts (one) like poverty.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural reminds us to help people who don't have enough. When we share our lunch with a friend who forgot theirs, we're being kind and helpful!
all_explanations.original_english: When cruel poverty comes on  it deprives one of both the present and future (bliss).
