all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural reminds us to help people who don't have enough. When we share our lunch with a friend who forgot theirs, we're being kind and helpful!
all_explanations.original_english: Hankering poverty destroys at once the greatness of (ones) ancient descent and (the dignity of ones) speech.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural reminds us to help people who don't have enough. When we share our lunch with a friend who forgot theirs, we're being kind and helpful!
all_explanations.original_english: Even in those of high birth  poverty will produce the fault of uttering mean words.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural reminds us to help people who don't have enough. When we share our lunch with a friend who forgot theirs, we're being kind and helpful!
all_explanations.original_english: The misery of poverty brings in its train many (more) miseries.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural reminds us to help people who don't have enough. When we share our lunch with a friend who forgot theirs, we're being kind and helpful!
all_explanations.original_english: The words of the poor are profitless  though they may be sound in thought and clear in expression.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural reminds us to help people who don't have enough. When we share our lunch with a friend who forgot theirs, we're being kind and helpful!
all_explanations.original_english: He that is reduced to absolute poverty will be regarded as a stranger even by his own mother.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural reminds us to help people who don't have enough. When we share our lunch with a friend who forgot theirs, we're being kind and helpful!
all_explanations.original_english: Is the poverty that almost killed me yesterday  to meet me today too ?

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural reminds us to help people who don't have enough. When we share our lunch with a friend who forgot theirs, we're being kind and helpful!
all_explanations.original_english: One may sleep in the midst of fire; but by no means in the midst of poverty.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural reminds us to help people who don't have enough. When we share our lunch with a friend who forgot theirs, we're being kind and helpful!
all_explanations.original_english: The destitute poor  who do not renounce their bodies  only consume their neighbours salt and water.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural reminds us to help people who don't have enough. When we share our lunch with a friend who forgot theirs, we're being kind and helpful!
all_explanations.original_english: If you meet with those that may be begged of  you may beg; (but) if they withhold (their gift) it is their blame and not yours.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural reminds us to help people who don't have enough. When we share our lunch with a friend who forgot theirs, we're being kind and helpful!
all_explanations.original_english: Even begging may be pleasant  if what is begged for is obtained without grief (to him that begs).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural reminds us to help people who don't have enough. When we share our lunch with a friend who forgot theirs, we're being kind and helpful!
all_explanations.original_english: There is even a beauty in standing before and begging of those who are liberal in their gifts and understand their duty (to beggars).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural reminds us to help people who don't have enough. When we share our lunch with a friend who forgot theirs, we're being kind and helpful!
all_explanations.original_english: To beg of such as never think of withholding (their charity) even in their dreams  is in fact the same as giving (it oneself);

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural reminds us to help people who don't have enough. When we share our lunch with a friend who forgot theirs, we're being kind and helpful!
all_explanations.original_english: As there are in the world those that give without refusing  there are (also) those that prefer to beg by simply standing before them.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural reminds us to help people who don't have enough. When we share our lunch with a friend who forgot theirs, we're being kind and helpful!
all_explanations.original_english: All the evil of begging will be removed at the sight of those who are far from the evil of refusing.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural reminds us to help people who don't have enough. When we share our lunch with a friend who forgot theirs, we're being kind and helpful!
all_explanations.original_english: Beggars rejoice exceedingly when they behold those who bestow (their alms) with kindness and courtesy.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural reminds us to help people who don't have enough. When we share our lunch with a friend who forgot theirs, we're being kind and helpful!
all_explanations.original_english: If there were no beggars  (the actions done in) the cool wide world would only resemble the movement of a puppet.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural reminds us to help people who don't have enough. When we share our lunch with a friend who forgot theirs, we're being kind and helpful!
all_explanations.original_english: What (praise) would there be to givers (of alms) if there were no beggars to ask for and receive (them).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural reminds us to help people who don't have enough. When we share our lunch with a friend who forgot theirs, we're being kind and helpful!
all_explanations.original_english: He who begs ought not to be angry (at a refusal); for even the misery of (his own) poverty should be a sufficient reason (for so doing).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Not to beg (at all) even from those excellent persons who cheerfully give without refusing  will do immense good.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural reminds us to help people who don't have enough. When we share our lunch with a friend who forgot theirs, we're being kind and helpful!
all_explanations.original_english: If the Creator of the world has decreed even begging as a means of livelihood  may he too go abegging and perish.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: There is no greater folly than the boldness with which one seeks to remedy the evils of poverty by begging (rather than by working).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural reminds us to help people who don't have enough. When we share our lunch with a friend who forgot theirs, we're being kind and helpful!
all_explanations.original_english: Even the whole world cannot suficiently praise the dignity that would not beg even in the midst of destitution.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Even thin gruel is ambrosia to him who has obtained it by labour.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural reminds us to help people who don't have enough. When we share our lunch with a friend who forgot theirs, we're being kind and helpful!
all_explanations.original_english: There is nothing more disgraceful to ones tongue than to use it in begging water even for a cow.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural reminds us to help people who don't have enough. When we share our lunch with a friend who forgot theirs, we're being kind and helpful!
all_explanations.original_english: I beseech all beggars and say  If you need to beg  never beg of those who give unwillingly.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural reminds us to help people who don't have enough. When we share our lunch with a friend who forgot theirs, we're being kind and helpful!
all_explanations.original_english: The unsafe raft of begging will split when it strikes on the rock of refusal.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural reminds us to help people who don't have enough. When we share our lunch with a friend who forgot theirs, we're being kind and helpful!
all_explanations.original_english: To think of (the evil of) begging is enough to melt ones heart; but to think of refusal is enough to break it.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural reminds us to help people who don't have enough. When we share our lunch with a friend who forgot theirs, we're being kind and helpful!
all_explanations.original_english: Saying No to a beggar takes away his life. (but as that very word will kill the refuser) where then would the latters life hide itself ?

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The base resemble men perfectly (as regards form); and we have not seen such (exact) resemblance (among any other species).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: The low enjoy more felicity than those who know what is good; for the former are not troubled with anxiety (as to the good).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us about God and how important it is to remember Him. Just like we remember our parents who love us, we should remember God who created everything!
all_explanations.original_english: The base resemble the Gods; for the base act as they like.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The base feels proud when he sees persons whose acts meaner than his own.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: (The principle of) behaviour in the mean is chiefly fear; if not  hope of gain  to some extent.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The base are like a drum that is beaten  for they unburden to others the secrets they have heard.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The mean will not (even) shake of (what sticks to) their hands (soon after a meal) to any but those who would break their jaws with their clenched fists.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The great bestow (their alms) as soon as they are informed; (but) the mean  like the sugar-cane  only when they are tortured to death.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us to be good and kind. When we do good things and help others, we feel happy inside, just like when you share your toys with friends!
all_explanations.original_english: The base will bring an evil (accusation) against others  as soon as he sees them (enjoying) good food and clothing.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The base will hasten to sell themselves as soon as a calamity has befallen them. For what else are they fitted ?

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Is this jewelled female a celestial  a choice peahen  or a human being ? My mind is perplexed.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: This female beauty returning my looks is like a celestial maiden coming with an army to contend against me.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: I never knew before what is called Yama; I see it now; it is the eyes that carry on a great fight with (the help of) female qualities.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: These eyes that seem to kill those who look at them are as it were in hostilities with this feminine simplicity.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Is it Yama  (a pair of) eyes or a hind ?- Are not all these three in the looks of this maid ?

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Her eyes will cause (me) no trembling sorrow  if they are properly hidden by her cruel arched eye-brows.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The cloth that covers the firm bosom of this maiden is (like) that which covers the eyes of a rutting elephant.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: On her bright brow alone is destroyed even that power of mine that used to terrify the most fearless foes in the battlefield.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Of what use are other jewels to her who is adorned with modesty  and the meek looks of a hind ?

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about love! Love makes us feel warm and happy, like a big hug from someone special. We should show love to our family and friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Unlike boiled honey which yields delight only when it is drunk  love give spleasure even when looked at.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: There are two looks in the dyed eyes of this (fair one); one causes pain  and the other is the cure thereof.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: A single stolen glance of her eyes is more than half the pleasure (of sexual embrace).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about love! Love makes us feel warm and happy, like a big hug from someone special. We should show love to our family and friends!
all_explanations.original_english: She has looked (at men) and stooped (her head); and that (sign) waters as it were (the corn of) our love.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: When I look  she looks down; when I do not  she looks and smiles gently.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: She not only avoids a direct look at me  but looks as it were with a half-closed eye and smiles.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural talks about friends! Good friends are like treasures - they play with you, help you, and make you smile. We should choose kind friends and be kind friends too!
all_explanations.original_english: Though they may speak harshly as if they were strangers  the words of the friendly are soon understood.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about love! Love makes us feel warm and happy, like a big hug from someone special. We should show love to our family and friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Little words that are harsh and looks that are hateful are (but) the expressions of lovers who wish to act like strangers.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: When I look  the pitying maid looks in return and smiles gently; and that is a comforting sign for me.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: Both the lovers are capable of looking at each other in an ordinary way  as if they were perfect strangers.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about love! Love makes us feel warm and happy, like a big hug from someone special. We should show love to our family and friends!
all_explanations.original_english: The words of the mouths are of no use whatever  when there is perfect agreement between the eyes (of lovers).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The (simultaneous) enjoyment of the five senses of sight  hearing  taste  smell and touch can only be found with bright braceleted (women).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The remedy for a disease is always something diferent (from it); but for the disease caused by this jewelled maid  she is herself the cure.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about love! Love makes us feel warm and happy, like a big hug from someone special. We should show love to our family and friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Can the lotus-eyed Vishnus heaven be indeed as sweet to those who delight to sleep in the delicate arms of their beloved ?

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: From whence has she got this fire that burns when I withdraw and cools when I approach ?

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The shoulders of her whose locks are adorned with flowers delight me as if they were the very sweets I have desired (to get).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: The shoulders of this fair one are made of ambrosia  for they revive me with pleasure every time I embrace them.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about family and home. Our family loves us and takes care of us, just like a bird's nest keeps baby birds safe and warm!
all_explanations.original_english: What avails sorrow when I am without a wife who can understand the cause of my sorrow?

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about love! Love makes us feel warm and happy, like a big hug from someone special. We should show love to our family and friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Like water in the shade  dislike is delicious only in those who love.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: It is nothing but strong desire that makes her mind unite with me who can leave her to her own dislike.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: You are given to prostitution; all those who are born as womankind enjoy you with their eyes in an ordinary way. I will not embrace you.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: When I continued to be sulky he sneezed and thought I would (then) wish him a long life.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Even if I were adorned with a garland of branch-flowers  she would say I did so to show it to another woman.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about love! Love makes us feel warm and happy, like a big hug from someone special. We should show love to our family and friends!
all_explanations.original_english: When I said I loved her more than any other woman  she said more than others  yes  more than others  and remained sulky.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: When I said I would never part from her in this life her eyes were filled with tears.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural reminds us to help people who don't have enough. When we share our lunch with a friend who forgot theirs, we're being kind and helpful!
all_explanations.original_english: When I said I had remembered her  she said I had forgotten her and relaxing her embrace  began to feign dislike.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about leaders and how they should be fair and kind. Just like a good class monitor helps everyone, good leaders take care of all people!
all_explanations.original_english: When I sneezed she blessed me  but at once changed (her mind) and wept  asking  At the thought of whom did you sneeze?

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: When I suppressed my sneezing  she wept saying  I suppose you (did so) to hide from me your own peoples remembrance of you.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Even when I try to remove her dislike  she is displeased and says  This is the way you behave towards (other women).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Even when I look on her contemplating (her beauty)  she is displeased and says  With whose thought have you (thus) looked on my person?

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Although my husband is free from defects  the way in which he embraces me is such as to make me feign dislike.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about love! Love makes us feel warm and happy, like a big hug from someone special. We should show love to our family and friends!
all_explanations.original_english: His love will increase though it may (at first seem to) fade through the short-lived distress caused by (my) dislike.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: Is there a celestial land that can please like the feigned dislike of those whose union resembles that of earth and water?

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: In prolonged dislike after an embrace there is a weapon that can break my heart.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about love! Love makes us feel warm and happy, like a big hug from someone special. We should show love to our family and friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Though free from defects  men feel pleased when they cannot embrace the delicate shoulders of those whom they love.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about love! Love makes us feel warm and happy, like a big hug from someone special. We should show love to our family and friends!
all_explanations.original_english: To digest what has been eaten is more delightful than to eat more; likewise love is more delightful in dislike than intercourse.

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about love! Love makes us feel warm and happy, like a big hug from someone special. We should show love to our family and friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Those are conquerors whose dislike has been defeated and that is proved by the love (which follows).

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about love! Love makes us feel warm and happy, like a big hug from someone special. We should show love to our family and friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Will I enjoy once more through her dislike  the pleasure of that love that makes her forehead perspire?

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural teaches us an important lesson about life. It helps us understand how to be better people and live happily with others!
all_explanations.original_english: May the bright-jewelled one feign dislike  and may the night be prolonged for me to implore her!

all_explanations.child_explanation: This kural is about love! Love makes us feel warm and happy, like a big hug from someone special. We should show love to our family and friends!
all_explanations.original_english: Dislike adds delight to love; and a hearty embrace (thereafter) will add delight to dislike.
